security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only knowledge base skill. It provides guidance and grep patterns for auditing Neovim configurations but does not execute code or access sensitive data. The allowed tools (Read, Bash, Grep, Glob) are appropriate for config auditing. Bash commands shown are for user-initiated diagnostics only.

low_findings.title: Bash commands access user config directory
low_findings.description: The skill documents Bash commands that access the user's Neovim configuration directory (~/.config/nvim). While appropriate for auditing, these commands read user files. Example from SKILL.md line 37: `grep -rn "nvim_buf_set_option\|nvim_win_set_option" ~/.config/nvim --include="*.lua" 2>/dev/null | head -10`. An attacker could modify the skill to target other sensitive directories like ~/.ssh or ~/.aws, but the skill's documentation-only nature and limited scope mitigate this risk.

content.value_statement: Neovim configurations can accumulate deprecated APIs, performance issues, and security vulnerabilities over time. This skill provides systematic checklists, detection patterns, and best practices to audit configurations, identify problems, and receive actionable fix recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Detects deprecated and removed Neovim APIs by version
Identifies security issues like exposed credentials and insecure shell commands
Checks for performance problems including slow startup and synchronous loading
Provides grading system from A-F based on issue severity
Offers fix recommendations with code examples
limitations: Only audits Neovim configurations, not other editors or tools
Cannot detect plugin-specific issues beyond general patterns
Requires Neovim to be installed for version detection

use_cases.title: Verify plugin compatibility
use_cases.description: Check if your plugin configurations use current Neovim APIs and follow best practices for lazy loading.

use_cases.title: Security vulnerability scanning
use_cases.description: Scan team configurations for exposed credentials, insecure commands, and dangerous settings like modeline.

use_cases.title: Performance optimization
use_cases.description: Identify slow startup causes, unnecessary plugins, and optimize your configuration for faster loading.

prompt_templates.title: Quick health check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a quick health check on my Neovim configuration. Check the Neovim version, count plugins, and look for any obvious issues.

prompt_templates.title: Deprecated API scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan my Neovim config for deprecated APIs. My Neovim version is [VERSION]. Show me what needs to be updated.

prompt_templates.title: Security audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a security audit on my Neovim configuration. Look for exposed credentials, insecure shell commands, and dangerous settings.

prompt_templates.title: Full configuration review
prompt_templates.prompt: Do a complete audit of my Neovim configuration. Check structure, performance, security, and compatibility. Give me a grade and specific recommendations for each issue found.

output: - 1 instance of nvim_buf_set_option (deprecated 0.10, removed: not yet) - replace with vim.bo[bufnr].option
- 3 instances of synchronous plugin loading without lazy events
- Consider modular structure for init.lua (>200 lines)

best_practices: Use vim.opt for list-like options and vim.o for simple values instead of vim.cmd for settings
Lazy load plugins using event, cmd, ft, or keys triggers to improve startup time
Check Neovim version before using newer APIs and add version guards for compatibility
anti_patterns: Using vim.cmd("set number") instead of vim.o.number = true
Requiring plugins at the top of config files without lazy loading
Mixing vim.opt and vim.o for the same option creates confusion

faq.question: Which Neovim versions are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports Neovim 0.8 through 0.11 and nightly builds. Version-specific deprecated API detection adapts to the detected version.

faq.question: What is the maximum config size it can handle?
faq.answer: The skill uses grep and find which handle configs of any size. Very large configs may take longer to process completely.

faq.question: Can it integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. The grep patterns and bash commands can be run in CI. The audit generates machine-parseable output suitable for automation.

faq.question: Does it modify my configuration files?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reads and analyzes configurations. All fixes are recommended as documentation - you apply changes manually.

faq.question: What happens if Neovim is not installed?
faq.answer: Version detection commands will fail gracefully. The skill can still check for deprecated APIs using grep patterns without version context.

faq.question: How does this compare to built-in health checks?
faq.answer: The skill provides more comprehensive checks including security scans, deprecated API detection, and best practices guidance beyond basic health checks.
